title: Removing Duplicates with a Set
creator: Dan McCreary
subject: Computer Science
description: Interactive MicroSim that demonstrates removing duplicate values by converting a list to a set and then converting back to a list.

learningObjectives: Students will be able to use a set to remove duplicate values from a list by stepping through conversion and observing duplicates being discarded.

pedagogical.teachingStrategy: Step-by-step guided visualization with immediate feedback
keyQuestions: Why does the set reject repeated values?
How does converting back to a list preserve uniqueness?
commonMisconceptions: A set keeps every repeated value
Converting to a set and back keeps original duplicates
assessmentOpportunities: Explain acceptance vs rejection at each step
